column4: IppatsuMan: can you pastebin the output of "apt-cache policy libavutil-extra-51 libavutil51"

http://paste.ubuntu.com/752631/ . The output of aptitude after using "r <id>" is like: "Remove the following packages: 1)   R   audacity 2)       ffmpeg" and stays pretty much similar even if I add al the packages using "r <id>"
yes, that's just the refresh for you to see what you chose.  Next you tell it "n" to try harder
there is also a syntax to tell aptitude to install a package and remove another one in the command line.
pressing "n" just gives me the same list, with more "R"s
can you pastebin that output?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/752636/ (just a sample, it does not change much)
ah, end of the line: *** No more solutions available ***
I don't want to waste your time, I was just curious because I thought aptitude was the smart one. I'll look for a way to tell it to remove a package and substitute with another one
it's smart with well made packages
these two... are not well made.
there is also a syntax to tell aptitude to install a package and remove another one in the command line, what happens with: aptitude install libavutil51 libavutil-extra-51-
note the tailing -
bingo. It works. I have to use "aptitude -s install libavutil51 libavcodec53 libavutil-extra-51- libavcodec-extra-53-" due to extra dependencies, but it works
you may or may not notify the "medibuntu" people their package dependencies need improvement
however, I don't know how I would make it work if dependencies were more complicated than that
a dirtier workaround is to first dpkg --remove --force-depends the current package, and then let "apt-get -f install" or "aptitude -f install" autofix the dependencies
this would need to be done carefully
however, is not a problem of medibuntu packages. It is broken with ubuntu official repositories too
(I knew about dpkg, but I didn't want to mess up my system)
it's not, because libavutil-extra-51 doesn't seem to exist in oneiric AT ALL
based on your policy paste
I didn't check the actual repos
arlight then, I'll take your work for it being broken in ubuntu as well. :-)
